intro: Tristania suaveolens var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth Tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub with smooth, glabrous stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
